title: How many pages can you read in 30 minutes? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the pacing, genre and page size of the book I’m reading. Say the pacing of the story is ‘fast’. Clear, sharp words and defining sentences. Events move quickly between paragraphs. I follow the author’s intent and I read the pages faster than I normally would. I could read about 20–30 pages. Say the pacing of the story is ‘slow’. Words are ambiguous, the vocabulary is a little above my own level, the dialogue is longer (And probably more realistic, from my own experience in reading slow-paced novels) and the sentences and events drag on through the pages. Progression is slow, and I follow the author’s intent and I read the pages slower than I normally would. I could read about 10–20 pages. Say the pacing of the story is a mix between the two, I could probably read 20 pages. I read a lot of fantasy, and that genre tends to have longer pages and a smaller word size, so regardless of the pacing I could probably read 10–15 pages. How interested I am in the book at all also affects how much I read. So to summarize: I read could read from 10–30 pages for 30 minutes.

It all depends on the book. If it’s fiction, I could easily read 30–50 pages per half-hour, depending on chapter length, font size, and pacing. If it’s non-fiction, the number varies. If it’s on a subject I’m already familiar with, or a re-read; I usually read around 20–40 pages per half-hour. If it’s on subject I’m just getting into, or is a text more complex than meets the eye; anywhere from 10–40 pages per half-hour is the norm. In all, it goes from as little as 10 pages to 50 pages.
